citations.narrative:
During the review of paperwork and records, it was noted that the disposition records were incomplete. All required
information for whom the animals were sold was unavailable at the time of inspection. The disposition records for 7
domestic rabbits did not have addresses, or license numbers for the buyer.
Appropriate documentation of regulated animals is essential for proper identification, to trace and track animals in case of
disease outbreak, and to ensure all parties that are required to be licensed have a current, valid license.
Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following
information concerning animals, other than dogs and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or
otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise
disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall include any offspring of any animal while in his or her possession
or under his or her control.
Correct By September 10, 2024

A section of the perimeter fence sustained damage from a previous storm. Behind the fox enclosure was a section of the
perimeter fence that had portions of the upper crossbar bent or broken. This caused the fence to dip down below 5 feet in
height.
Animals and unauthorized people could use these damaged areas of the perimeter fence to gain access to the animals
behind it.
The fence must be constructed so that it protects the animals in the facility by restricting animals and unauthorized
persons from going through it or under it and having contact with the animals in the facility, and so that it can function as a
secondary containment system for the animals in the facility. To be corrected before the next relicense inspection.
Correct by September 10, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
During the review of paperwork and records, it was noted that the disposition records were incomplete. All required 
information for whom the animals were sold was unavailable at the time of inspection. The disposition records for 7 
domestic rabbits did not have addresses, or license numbers for the buyer. 
 
Appropriate documentation of regulated animals is essential for proper identification, to trace and track animals in case of 
disease outbreak, and to ensure all parties that are required to be licensed have a current, valid license. 
 
Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following 
information concerning animals, other than dogs and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or 
otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise 
disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall include any offspring of any animal while in his or her possession 
or under his or her control. 
 
Correct By September 10, 2024 
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
A section of the perimeter fence sustained damage from a previous storm. Behind the fox enclosure was a section of the 
perimeter fence that had portions of the upper crossbar bent or broken. This caused the fence to dip down below 5 feet in 
height.  
 
Animals and unauthorized people could use these damaged areas of the perimeter fence to gain access to the animals 
behind it. 
 
The fence must be constructed so that it protects the animals in the facility by restricting animals and unauthorized 
persons from going through it or under it and having contact with the animals in the facility, and so that it can function as a 
secondary containment system for the animals in the facility. To be corrected before the next relicense inspection.

Correct by September 10, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
